messages: You stay in the atmosphere as CO2.
You are taken up by a plant in photosynthesis and become glucose (C6H1206)
You are jostled by wind and wave action and dissolve in seawater.
You are CO2 in soil air.
You are a carbon compound within detritus.
You are taken in by a plan doing photosynthesis.
You are part of dead plant tissue, become trapped in anoxic soil, and with high temperature and pressure you become a fossil fuel.
You diffuse into the sky on a warm breeze.
You are in a leaf, but the tree sheds all its leaves.
You are in the cellulose within the xylem in a tree trunk.
You are in starch within the cytoplasm of a root cell in a tree.
You are in sucrose (C12H22O11) within the phloem in a tree branch.
You are in glucose (C6H12O6) within a fruit and that fruit is eaten by an animal
You were glucose (C6H12O6) in the leaf, but the leaf cell respired and now you're CO2.
You stay in the deep ocean.
You join an upwelling current.
You are swallowed by a dolphin.
You are methane (CH4).
You are crude oil, a mixture of substances that is about 85% carbon.
You are coal (C137H97O9).
You are in peat, a mixture of substances that is 48-63% carbon.
You are pumped out of the ground by humans, burned in a car engine, and are now CO2.
You became rock, underwent subduction, melted, and after a volcanic eruption on Hawaii emerge as CO2.
You join a downwelling current.
You were in a protein within an organism that died and sank to the bottom of the ocean.
You are floating in a calm sea.
You move up into the atmosphere with wind and wave action.
You are part of a lipid molecule in adipose tissue.
You are part of a food chain because a predator eats the animal you are in.
You are in a carcass in the ground, as the animal that ate you died.
You are exhaled as CO2, because the animal that consumed you did cellular respiration.
